native_answer: Un ramo de: Recogí un ramo de flores.
prompt: ______: I picked a bunch of flowers.
answer: A bunch of: I picked a bunch of flowers.
audio_dir: A bunch of: I picked a bunch of flowers.

native_answer: Algunos (contables): Ella tiene algunos amigos cercanos.
prompt: ______ (countable): She has a few close friends.
answer: A few (countable): She has a few close friends.
audio_dir: A few (countable): She has a few close friends.

native_answer: Un poco (no contable): Tomaré un poco más de café.
prompt: ______ (uncountable): I’ll have a little more coffee.
answer: A little (uncountable): I’ll have a little more coffee.
audio_dir: A little (uncountable): I’ll have a little more coffee.

native_answer: Mucho: Hay mucho tráfico hoy.
prompt: ______: There’s a lot of traffic today.
answer: A lot: There’s a lot of traffic today.
audio_dir: A lot: There’s a lot of traffic today.

native_answer: Un montón de: Él trajo un montón de bocadillos.
prompt: ______: He brought a ton of snacks.
answer: A ton of: He brought a ton of snacks.
audio_dir: A ton of: He brought a ton of snacks.

native_answer: Todos: Todos los boletos están agotados.
prompt: ______: ______ the tickets are sold out.
answer: All: All the tickets are sold out.
audio_dir: All: All the tickets are sold out.

native_answer: Una cantidad excesiva de: La empresa gastó una cantidad excesiva de dinero en publicidad.
prompt: ______: The company spent an excessive amount of money on advertising.
answer: An excessive amount of: The company spent an excessive amount of money on advertising.
audio_dir: An excessive amount of: The company spent an excessive amount of money on advertising.

native_answer: Alguno: ¿Tienes alguna pregunta?
prompt: ______: Do you have any questions?
answer: Any: Do you have any questions?
audio_dir: Any: Do you have any questions?

native_answer: Tantos como: Hubo hasta 50 participantes.
prompt: As many as: There were ______ 50 participants.
answer: As many as: There were as many as 50 participants.
audio_dir: As many as: There were as many as 50 participants.

native_answer: Tanto como: Él no come tanto como yo.
prompt: As much as: He doesn’t eat ______ I do.
answer: As much as: He doesn’t eat as much as I do.
audio_dir: As much as: He doesn’t eat as much as I do.

native_answer: Ambos: Ambas respuestas son correctas.
prompt: ______: ______ answers are correct.
answer: Both: Both answers are correct.
audio_dir: Both: Both answers are correct.

native_answer: Cada: Cada estudiante recibió un libro.
prompt: ______: ______ student received a book.
answer: Each: Each student received a book.
audio_dir: Each: Each student received a book.

native_answer: Cada: Cada niño merece una educación.
prompt: ______: ______ child deserves an education.
answer: Every: Every child deserves an education.
audio_dir: Every: Every child deserves an education.

native_answer: Pocos (contables): Pocas personas conocen la verdad.
prompt: ______ (countable): ______ people know the truth.
answer: Few (countable): Few people know the truth.
audio_dir: Few (countable): Few people know the truth.

native_answer: Menos: Hay menos coches en la carretera hoy.
prompt: Fewer: There are ______ cars on the road today.
answer: Fewer: There are fewer cars on the road today.
audio_dir: Fewer: There are fewer cars on the road today.

native_answer: Casi ninguno: No hay casi nada de leche en el refrigerador.
prompt: ______: There’s hardly any milk in the fridge.
answer: Hardly any: There’s hardly any milk in the fridge.
audio_dir: Hardly any: There’s hardly any milk in the fridge.

native_answer: Menos: Deberíamos gastar menos tiempo en esta tarea.
prompt: Less: We should spend ______ time on this task.
answer: Less: We should spend less time on this task.
audio_dir: Less: We should spend less time on this task.

native_answer: Poco: Hay poca esperanza de éxito.
prompt: ______: There’s little hope for success.
answer: Little: There’s little hope for success.
audio_dir: Little: There’s little hope for success.

native_answer: Muchas: Ella tiene muchas ideas.
prompt: ______: She has lots of ideas.
answer: Lots of: She has lots of ideas.
audio_dir: Lots of: She has lots of ideas.

native_answer: Muchos (contables): ¿Cuántas personas vienen?
prompt: ______ (countable): How many people are coming?
answer: Many (countable): How many people are coming?
audio_dir: Many (countable): How many people are coming?

native_answer: Más: Necesito más agua para llenar la botella.
prompt: More: I need ______ water to fill the bottle.
answer: More: I need more water to fill the bottle.
audio_dir: More: I need more water to fill the bottle.

native_answer: Mucho (no contable): No queda mucha azúcar.
prompt: ______ (uncountable): There isn’t much sugar left.
answer: Much (uncountable): There isn’t much sugar left.
audio_dir: Much (uncountable): There isn’t much sugar left.

native_answer: No tantos como: No hay tantos como esperábamos.
prompt: Not as many as: There aren’t as many as we expected.
answer: Not as many as: There aren’t as many as we expected.
audio_dir: Not as many as: There aren’t as many as we expected.

native_answer: No tanto como: Ella no duerme tanto como su hermano.
prompt: Not as much as: She doesn’t sleep as much as her brother.
answer: Not as much as: She doesn’t sleep as much as her brother.
audio_dir: Not as much as: She doesn’t sleep as much as her brother.

native_answer: No suficiente: No hay suficiente tiempo para terminar.
prompt: ______: There isn’t not enough time to finish.
answer: Not enough: There isn’t not enough time to finish.
audio_dir: Not enough: There isn’t not enough time to finish.

native_answer: No muchos (contables): No muchos estudiantes asistieron a la conferencia.
prompt: ______ (countable): ______ students attended the lecture.
answer: Not many (countable): Not many students attended the lecture.
audio_dir: Not many (countable): Not many students attended the lecture.

native_answer: No mucho (no contable): No hay mucho interés en la idea.
prompt: ______ (uncountable): There’s not much interest in the idea.
answer: Not much (uncountable): There’s not much interest in the idea.
audio_dir: Not much (uncountable): There’s not much interest in the idea.

native_answer: Numerosos: Cometieron numerosos errores.
prompt: ______: They made numerous mistakes.
answer: Numerous: They made numerous mistakes.
audio_dir: Numerous: They made numerous mistakes.

native_answer: Bastante: Tenemos tiempo de sobra para terminar.
prompt: ______: We have plenty of time to finish.
answer: Plenty: We have plenty of time to finish.

native_answer: Apenas ninguno: Apenas tenían comida restante.
prompt: ______: They had scarcely any food left.
answer: Scarcely any: They had scarcely any food left.
audio_dir: Scarcely any: They had scarcely any food left.

native_answer: Algo: Necesito algo de ayuda con esto.
prompt: ______: I need some help with this.
answer: Some: I need some help with this.

native_answer: Lo menos: Esta opción requiere el menor esfuerzo.
prompt: The least: This option requires ______ effort.
answer: The least: This option requires the least effort.
audio_dir: The least: This option requires the least effort.

native_answer: Lo más: Ella posee los vestidos más hermosos.
prompt: The most: She owns ______ beautiful dresses.
answer: The most: She owns the most beautiful dresses.

native_answer: Demasiadas pocas (contables): Hay muy pocas sillas para todos.
prompt: ______ (countable): There are too few chairs for everyone.

audio_dir: Too few (countable): There are too few chairs for everyone.
